com.fasterxml.storemate.store

Class StoreConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.storemate.store.StoreConfig

  • public class StoreConfig
extends Object
    Simple configuration class for StorableStore

      • DEFAULT_LOCK_PARTITIONS

        public static final int DEFAULT_LOCK_PARTITIONS
        Default number of partitions in which local keyspace is sliced, for purpose of locking per-entry access; balanced between granularity of access (to minimize lock contention) and overhead of managing locks. 64 seems like a reasonable initial guess.

        Note that in addition to memory overhead, there is additional overhead for finding latest in-flight timestamp, which is a linear operation (although only called during node-to-node synclist access).

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • compressionEnabled

        public boolean compressionEnabled
        Whether automatic compression of stored data is enabled or not.

      • requireChecksumForPreCompressed

        public boolean requireChecksumForPreCompressed
        Whether checksum is required when storing pre-compressed entries, for actual uncompressed content. If so, and caller does not provide checksum, exception will be thrown. Otherwise checksum verification can not be used.

      • lockPartitions

        public int lockPartitions
        Per-entry access is protected by a hash-based partitioned mutex; more partitions there are, lower is the expected lock contention, but more memory overhead there is. Value must be power of 2; if not, it will be rounded up to nearest such value.

        Note that in addition to memory overhead, there is additional overhead for finding latest in-flight timestamp, which is a linear operation.

      • dataRootForFiles

        public File dataRootForFiles
        Name of root directory (using relative or absolute path) under which data files will be located (possibly with additional dir hierarchy).

      • maxInlinedStorageSize

        public int maxInlinedStorageSize
        Maximum size of entries that are to be stored inline in the database, instead of written out separately on file system.

        Default value of about 4k is aligned to typical page size.

      • minUncompressedSizeForCompression

        public int minUncompressedSizeForCompression
        Minimum size an entry needs to have before we consider trying to compress it. Low threshold used since smallest of content will not compress (due to header overhead etc).

      • maxUncompressedSizeForGZIP

        public int maxUncompressedSizeForGZIP
        Maximum uncompressed size of payload that will try to use GZIP encoding; bigger payloads will use LZF due to reduced I/O costs (and skippability of content).

        Goal is to try to gzip inlined entries, use LZF for disk; and assuming 4-to-1 compression we will use default size of 16k

      • minPayloadForStreaming

        public int minPayloadForStreaming
        We will read up to this number of bytes in memory, before switching to actual streaming handling. Note that streaming content will never be inlined; and compression choice can not check whether content is compressible (beyond basic compression prefix checks)

      • offHeapBufferSize

        public org.skife.config.DataAmount offHeapBufferSize
        How much of off-heap memory can we use for buffering data for file-system operations (when copying data between request/response and file system).

        Note that buffering is used to try to reduce contention and concurrency for file system access, with assumption that there is often impedance between read/write speeds of request/response (network) and filesystem.

        Default size of 64 megabytes is chosen to stay under default limits for off-heap allocation

        Since:
        0.9.10

      • maxPerEntryBuffering

        public org.skife.config.DataAmount maxPerEntryBuffering
        Also: to support very large entries, let's limit buffering to first N bytes. Default is 1 megabyte.
        Since:
        0.9.10

      • storableConverter

        public Class<? extends StorableConverter> storableConverter
        StorableConverter implementation to use, if any
